Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel I have stayed in many hotels around the world. I love this hotel. The location is excellent, the rooms are very clean and there are so many shops, restuarants very nearby. I have stayed there twice. Would definitely recommend staying there.
Reviews.Author: harishbala

Reviews.Content: Everything you need!!! It is in a wonderful location, an excellent hotel with multiple restaurants.! It is also located in the Tokyo Dome City where there are amusements, restaurants, and a shopping mall...not to mention, the home stadium of the Tokyo Giants baseball game.It is located within a block of the Metro and two blocks from the JR train station. All aspects of service were outstanding; nothing missed! Many employees know English. Were so kind to supply a scale to help weigh my luggage.
Reviews.Author: Nsenya

Reviews.Content: Great for Business I recently traveled to Tokyo on a business trip. Due to the close promiximity to my company, we stayed at the Tokyo Dome Hotel. It is a very clean hotel with friendly staff.It does get very crowded on the main floor lobby, but you don't notice that when on the floor of your hotel. Furthermore, the noise that emanates from the actual Tokyo Dome (concerts) is quite prevalent if you're staying on that side of the hotel.My room was adequately sized, and so was the bathroom. I was on the 26th floor and had a great view from my room. The restaurant also has very nice restaurants in the hotel. I highly recommend the Korean BBQ restaurant.Close to train station. I would stay there again despite the crowdedness.
Reviews.Author: normaltravlr

Reviews.Content: A true Japanese hotel The entrance to the Tokyo dome hotel was a little hard to find, coming from the subway station. But that's hardly a surprise, as it's a huge building, so it takes 10 minutes to even walk around it.The hotel has a staggering 48 floors, and an enormous reception desk. The staff is friendly and all spoke english. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. My room was on the 24th floor and had an amazing view of the amusement park next to the hotel. The hotel has an english speaking tourist office and a shuttle to the airport, both of which were very useful in my case.
Reviews.Author: pek1977

Reviews.Content: Exceptional Service at Tokyo Dome This hotel was beautiful - the service exceptional - the cleanliness unsurpassed - and the artist's cafe at the top of the hotel offered beautiful views of the city at night. It was close to public transit and next door to the oldest park in the city. We even were able to witness a wedding taking place at our hotel in an open-air meeting room during our stay.For years, I have been traveling with a poster of Jack and Robert Kennedy - a family tradition where the Kennedys appear in the background unobtrusively in holiday photos. During my stay in Tokyo, I lost one earring from a favorite pair. I wrote to the hotel staff from home (Madison WI) and asked if they had by chance found the earring. I promptly received a package with a very polite note saying they had not found the earring but they had found the enclosed poster - my Kennedys had been left behind in a drawer!! I was very impressed with the thoroughness of the staff and their kindness in returning my (priceless) poster.Susan
Reviews.Author: JadeGirl3

Reviews.Content: Great hotel, reasonably priced, good location       Tokyo Dome Hotel
Reviews.Author: huw2006

Reviews.Content: Very good service and comfortable rooms I stay at the Tokyo Dome when I travel to Japan on business and it is a really comfortable and pleasant place. It's not really close to the trendier areas in Tokyo, but it is next to the train station and there are quite a few restaurants in the neighborhood to choose from (both asian and western).
Reviews.Author: yad2382

Reviews.Content: Tokyo Dome, very nice hotel- not the best location       Night view
Reviews.Author: koneko

Reviews.Content: Great rooms, good price The Tokyo Dome is a hi-rise hotel right next door to the baseball stadium of the same name. Ever felt like staying in a Tokyo Hotel like the one in Sophia Coppola's movie Lost in Translation? This is it. At night, you'll get great views of the immense city from pretty much every room in the building, except for the lower ones. During the day, the views are not so great because Tokyo is more beautiful at night. There are plenty of convenient shopping options in the complex nearby, including many restaurants (also within the hotel). Service, as everywhere in Japan, is impeccable. Hotel staff are corteous, polite, willing to help at all times. Parisians and New Yorkers could learn a lesson or two or a hundred from the japanese.Rooms are very, very clean and even spacious, in case you think every hotel room in Japan has tiny rooms. Bathrooms in Japan are something else, and you'd have to visit to learn details. On top of it all, this hotel is very affordable, much more so than any hotel of this category in any major city, be it New York, London or Rome. In fact, it is half the price of a hotel of the same quality in either one of the cities mentioned. Mine was a business trip, but I'd recommend this for a vacation as well. But do learn some japanese, because english is almost useless in Japan.
Reviews.Author: brazilianwanderlust

Reviews.Content: Worth the money Tokyo Dome is situated at the center of Tokyo's metropolitan area, next to the Giants' baseball stadium and 5min walk to JR Suidobashi station.I have been in Japan many times for many years and this hotel is one of the bests for the money.It has a good restaurant for breakfast, a little pricy though, but all is pricy in Japan anyway. Highly recommended for business travelers.
Reviews.Author: Tabinin

Reviews.Content: Great value for money We stayed at tokyo Dome Hotel twice in July 2006 and had a superb view from our room both times. The hotel is very clean and rooms pleasant, service friendly. The location of the hotel is great in many ways but especially if you fancy getting to know Japanese modern culture: a baseball game at the Dome, right next to the hotel. We had great time watching Tokyo Giants play! There is also many restaurants around the Dome and the hotel.
Reviews.Author: KatjaK

Reviews.Content: Very good My husband and I booked the Dome for 4 nights.The hotel is part of a complex, so you will have easy acces to metro stations, restaurants and shops.The staff is really friendly and helpfull, not everybody speaks English but they will find for someone that will help you.If you book this hotel you will have a good time, the rooms are spacious and clean.I didn't have food in the hotel because quiet frankly , the restaurants were very expensive compare with the restarurants in the surranding areas.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Outstanding, Beautiful and Cool       The view from my room 2
